conversations.content: Unselfish Love: Part One
There is none among the great dragons more kind of heart than Zodiark the Shadowwyrm—yet he is abhorred and called evil by some humans.
His scales once glittered like black agate, but their beauty has long since rotted away. Such is the reward for his tenderness.
Long ago, there was a land ruled by a kind queen. She was revered for her virtue and governed her people well, but an invasion of fiends put her country's very existence in danger.
She asked aid from the Shadowwyrm, who dwelt at the very edge of her domain. ＂Beautiful Shadowwyrm, my country needs your protection. Tell me what I must pay to receive it.＂
＂Nothing,＂ replied the Shadowwyrm. The queen was shocked, for she had been prepared to sacrifice herself if it was required of her.
＂You are in trouble. If you require my aid, then I shall do all in my power to help you.＂
With his help, their victory over the fiends was total. The queen, however, quickly grew corrupt after gaining the Shadowwyrm's promise of eternal protection.
She hid behind the dragon's strength, and used it to bend her subjects and neighbors to her will. Finally, the people tired of this, rebelled against her, and stormed the palace.
Realizing her foolishness, the queen turned on the Shadowwyrm. ＂You tempted me down this path!＂ she cried. The bewildered dragon could only stare at her.
＂Oh, but you have,＂ she continued. ＂You twisted my heart. You gave me all of your power and never asked that I bear any of its consequences!＂
＂Curse your unselfish love!＂ screamed the queen, who then flung herself off the balcony.
After the queen's death, the Shadowwyrm encountered many rulers. Few could wake themselves from the stupor the dragon's power induced, and many were ruined.
When a country is ruined, so, too, are its people. Eventually, those who had never even seen the Shadowwyrm grew to loathe the very mention of his name.
Unselfish Love: Part Two
Darkness turns nothing away. Any who borrow its power must eventually fight against their own weakness, and that is no easy task.
Humans came to revile the Shadowwyrm that threw the world into chaos. Dragons are not physical creatures so much as spiritual, and the humans' hatred corroded him.
The terrible sight of him—and his horrific shrieks of agony—terrified the humans, to whom he was already known as an enemy.
＂The humans despise me,＂ thought the Shadowwyrm through a haze of pain. ＂I am perishing under their wrath and hate.＂
＂Yet I cannot bring myself to hate them—indeed, I ADORE them. Is that truly so wrong?＂
The Shadowwyrm had many virtues,  perhaps none more resplendent than his unselfish love. Such mastery only underscored the imperfections in humanity's own love.
A man approached the Shadowwyrm as he lay in a cave, wracked with pain. ＂Stay back...＂ growled the dragon in a weak voice.
＂I will only cause you unhappiness. In any case, I cannot give you what you wish. Humanity's hatred has eroded my soul; I do not even have strength enough to fight my pain.＂
The man gently stroked one of the dragon's blistered scales. ＂Then let me ease your suffering. As you have cared for so many of my kind, let me now care for you.＂
For all the humans the Shadowwyrm had saved, this was the first one to try and save him.
Thus began a friendship between Aurelius and Zodiark that tore down the boundaries between human and dragonkind.
